events.name: 1st Google Cloud Platform Meetup in Ottawa. Come hang out, learn, & eat cake!
events.description:
Google has officially launched its planned Google Cloud Platform (GCP) region in Montreal in early 2018. Today, we are excited to announce the first GCP Meetup in Ottawa!

Join us on Monday, 18 June 2018 to learn about the Google Cloud Platform ecosystem and other open source projects that Google is contributing to, or that integrate with GCP.

One of these projects, Istio*, has its first birthday coming up and we want to celebrate it along with this meetup. Further, Istio 0.8 LTS is hot off the press, check out the release notes**, it‚Äôs packed with awesome new features and a bit of re-branding (Citadel üòç).

Cake, food, and beverages will be served (beer, water, and other non-alcoholic drinks).

Agenda:

- Intro (by Google)

- GKE Deep Dive (part 1) by Jonathan Pulsifer @Shopify, Ayrat Khayretdinov

- Using Calico networking with GKE and what's next? by Cody McCain @Tigera

- Istio one year after by Ayrat Khayretdinov - CNCF Ambassador

- Discussion: what would the community like to get out of this meetup in the future?

If anyone has feedback or is otherwise interested in contributing to this meetup (with a talk, workshop, sponsorship), or for any other inquiries, please get in contact with our leadership team***.

Thanks!

Jonathan and Tatiana

* https://istio.io
** https://istio.io/about/notes/0.8/
*** https://www.meetup.com/Google-Cloud-Platform-Meetup-Ottawa/members/?op=leaders
events.how_to_find_us: Use the Elgin St entrance and take the nearest elevator (by the large display) to the 6th floor

events.name: Cloud Next Extended '18 Ottawa

venue.name: Canadian Digital Service - Service Num√©rique Canadien

events.description:
Hello friends!

We are hosting a Next '18 Extended event in Ottawa on 16 October!

What are Next ‚Äò18 Extended events?

Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ‚Äò18 experience, either during the conference or even after! We'll be covering key announcements and features released during the https://cloud.withgoogle.com/next18 event in San Francisco along with a code lab.

What should I bring?

* A (charged) laptop if you want to participate in the code labs
* Yourself

Agenda:

- Welcome!

- Google Next 2018 key announcements by Ayrat Khayretdinov and Jonathan Pulsifer

- Intro to Machine Learning labs

- Administrivia
events.how_to_find_us: Canadian Digital Service 14th floor - People will be there to show you up to our space

events.name: AI/ML and Data services on GCP
events.description:
Welcome back! We finally starting a year with GDG Cloud Meetup Ottawa related to Data services, AI/ML on GCP overview and TensorFlow Dev Summit Recap. We going to try a new location for our Meetup! A huge thanks to Pythian for making this possible by hosting us, sponsoring beer and pizza and finally bringing some great speakers.
---
Pr√©sentations/Talk Schedule:

Talk #1: Intro and Tensorflow Dev Summit Recap.
By Archy, CNCF Ambassador
Length: 20 mins

Talk #2 Machine Learning API Hands-on
Length: 40 mins

Description: It‚Äôs no secret that machine learning is one of the fastest growing fields in tech, and the Google Cloud Platform has been instrumental in furthering it‚Äôs development. With a host of APIs, GCP has a tool for just about any machine learning job. In this intermediate-level presentation, we will experiment machine learning APIs such as:

- AI Chatbot with Dialogflow;
- Cloud Vision API to detect labels, faces, and landmarks in images;
- Cloud Vision, Natural Language, and Translation APIs to capture text strings from images, recognize characters, and analyze and translate the text strings into other languages;
- Natural Language API to classify text into categories, extract entities, and perform sentiment and syntactic analysis on a block of text;
- AutoML Vision to train a custom model to recognize different types of clouds (cumulus, cumulonimbus, etc.);
- Cloud ML Engine to train, hyperparameter train and deploy a TensorFlow model for serving purposes.

Short Bio: Carlos Timoteo is a Data Scientist at Pythian, with emphasis on Machine Learning Engineering to deploy scalable data solutions on the cloud. He also "loves his data" and holds MSc in Computer Engineer.

Talk #3 Google Cloud Storage & Databases
Length: 40 mins

Short Bio: Stephane Frechette is Google Cloud Solution Architect @ Pythian. His passions are Databases, Data Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, drums, good food and fine wine.

Description: Coming soon!

events.name: Google Next '19 Extended Ottawa and BBQ on Terrace!
events.description:
Did you miss Cloud Next '19 ? Don't worry! Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Ottawa will bring the event for you.

Cloud Next '19 - https://cloud.withgoogle.com/next/sf/ is the biggest Google Cloud Platform event that happens annually in San Francisco. It brings the world's most innovative and technologically advanced people for a chance to be apart of lectures and workshops.

This year we have some exciting speakers, demos and code labs planned.

üíºAgenda üíº
=============
Jonathan Pulsifer - Staff Infrastructure Security Engineer @ Shopify (an official Google Next Speaker!)
- What's New in GCP Security?

Archy - Cloud Architect @ CloudOps | CNCF Ambassador
- GCP Infra Update (Anthos, Cloud Run and many more)

Carlos Tim√≥teo - Data Scientist @ Pythian
- Key announcement in ML/AI

St√©phane Fr√©chette - Google Cloud Solution Architect @ Pythian
- Exciting news on Big Data and Databases
- New Certifications for GCP

üçîüç∫BBQ from GDG Cloud chefs @Pythian Terrace with amazing view, food and beer üçîüç∫

üôèSpecial thanks to Pythian for providing us with a venue and BBQ on the terrace with amazing view üôè

events.name: Cloud and ML DevFest 2019
events.description:
The DevFest season is here and GDG Cloud Montreal is hosting 1st Cloud/AI DevFest at ETS and invites Ottawa GDG Community to the event.
https://devfest.cloud-montreal.ca

Tickets are now available at :
https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/cloud-ai-devfest-2019-tickets-70094256809

üõë You only need to get your tickets from Eventbrite, you do not have to sign up on this meetup page for the event. üõë

üõëGDG Ottawa Community will receive 50% code discount for early bird ticketsüõë

The DevFest season is here and GDG Cloud Montreal is hosting 1st Cloud/AI DevFest at ETS.

Cloud and AI DevFest featuring:
8 speakers from Ottawa!!!
Our sponsors and supporters: CNCF, Google, Pythain, StackRox, Jfrog, Elastic
3 tracks : Cloud/CNCF/CI/CD | AI/ML | Security
20+ tech sessions : Check out our fantastic lineup.
3 workshops: Istio Service Mesh | Tensorflow on GCP | Chatbot with ML
4 CNCF Ambassadors: Archy, Chris Gaune, Baruch Sadagoursky, Lee Calcote
Breakfast, Coffee Brakes, Lunch, 5 a 7 with DJ

Agenda:

Workshops:
Istio Workshops by CNCF Ambassadors Lee Calcote & Archy
Tensorflow on GCP Cloud Study Jam by Carlos Timoteo
Implementing a Help Desk Chatbot with Dialogflow, BQML

Dev/DevOps/Cloud Native Track:
Everything you want to know about Google Anthos
Google Anthos user stories and demos
Build Your Own Serverless With Knative
Cloud Native CI/CD with Tekton
I'm a developer, should I care about a service mesh?
Unified Observability with OpenTelemetry
DevOps Patterns and Antipatterns for Continuous Software Updates
Applying GitOps and Progressive Delivery to Machine Learning Ops with Flux
Designing a complete CI-CD pipeline using Argo
Modern DevOps with Spinnaker
Kubernetes Operators for Kafka, Spark, Cassandra
Data integration with Cloud Data Fusion

AI/ML track:
Implementing a Help Desk Chatbot with Dialogflow
Advanced Analytics and ML with BigQuery
Validate and monitor your AI and machine learning models
Using machine learning to test faster than the competition!

Security Track:
Compliant Infrastructure as Code with Terraform and Atlantis
Advanced Analytics and ML with BigQuery by Bjoern Rost
Validate and monitor your AI and machine learning models
A/B testing on steroids. Using machine learning to test faster than the competition!

events.name: Machine Learning Study Jam
events.description:
PLEASE REGISTER HERE:
https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/machine-learning-study-jam-tickets-79758234025

Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Google Cloud technologies as a team.

Join us for a Firt Cloud Study Jam in Ottawa on Natural Language Processing and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning.

After the Study Jam, you‚Äôll receive:
* Swag
* 30-days free access to the entire Qwiklabs catalogue, so you can keep developing your skills at home.
* Complete all of the labs in the session‚Äôs quest, and you‚Äôll earn an additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well as a badge for your online profile.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don‚Äôt forget your charger.

Agenda
16:00 - 16:15 Sign in, Cofee, Snacks
16:15 - 17:00 Intro to Speech and Natural Language Processing ML, signing intro Qwiklabs
17:00 - 17:15 Signing intro Qwiklabs
17:15 - 18:30 QL Lab on your own pace
18:30 - 19:00 Dinner, Food, Socializing
19:00 - 20:45 QL Lab on your own pace
20:45 - 21:00 Raffle draw, study, socialize, and we leave!

events.name: Firebase Study Jam for Web [ONLINE ONLY - onsite event is cancelled]
events.description:
Dear GDG Cloud Ottawa community,

out of caution and to support social distancing, we would like to notify you that the Firebase Cloud Study Jam Meetup in Ottawa is canceled. However we provide access to Study Jam and provide online office hours.

We would like to provide our community free online access to labs so you can learn about Firebase with codelabs!

Additionally, we will have Firebase office hours via Google Meet: https://meet.google.com/awz-mhab-ydc
On March 18th From 17.00 - 19.00, if you have any issues with codelabs or questions about Firebase.

upcoming.name: GDG Cloud Ottawa May Online Meetup
upcoming.description:
=== Online Event Starts @ 6:00 ===

Join our Slack group: https://communityinviter.com/apps/gdgottawa/join-gdg-ottawa-community

Topic: GDG Cloud Ottawa May 2020
Time: May 26,[masked]:00 PM Ottawa

We will not be doing Zoom this time. We will use StreamYard so that anybody else can access our recording later on Youtube.

https://streamyard.com/746y7eg3nv

=== Networking ===
Getting to know each other, drinks and snacks BYO.
=== Small intro ===
Community announcements.
=== Talk 1 ===

Stephane Frechette

=== Talk 2 ===

TFX Training on AI Platform Pipelines
by Carlos Timoteo

Kubeflow is an open source ML platform dedicated to making deployments of machine learning (ML) workflows on Kubernetes simple, portable and scalable. Kubeflow Pipelines is part of the Kubeflow platform that enables composition and execution of reproducible workflows on Kubeflow, including TFX pipeline. A TFX pipeline is a sequence of components that implement an ML pipeline which is specifically designed for scalable, high-performance machine learning tasks. That includes modeling, training, serving inference, and managing deployments to online, native mobile, and JavaScript targets. On this presentation, we gonna learn how to do compute intensive model training (GPUs) on AI Platform using TFX.

Carlos Timoteo is ML Engineer @Pythian and GDE in Machine Learning.

=== Networking ===
Final
=== Closing ===
Closing around 7h30pm.
